Race.SummaryText:
City of Thibodaux Proposition
(1/2% Sales Tax)

Summary:  1/2% sales tax to be levied in perpetuity for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining, staffing and operating parks and recreation facilities and programs for the City of Thibodaux, including sites, equipment and furnishings and authorizing the issuance of bonds secured thereby.
Race.FullText:
Shall the City of Thibodaux, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (the "Tax") (an estimated $2,150,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), in perpetuity from and after July 1, 2012, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the City of Thibodaux, all as defined by law, in perpetuity, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining, staffing and operating parks and recreation facilities and programs for said City, including sites, equipment and furnishings, and shall said tax be subject to funding into bonds to be issued for any of the capital
purposes set forth above?
